item.title: Report X-2025050181
item.description:
Report X-2025050181

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-02T15:18:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-23
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER REPORTED TO DOOR 30 IN THE UNLOAD. WEARING PROPER PPE USED THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEETS FOR OXIDIZER WITH SECONDARY CORROSIVE. BOX WAS ON THE FLOOR IN THE TRAILER. THE BOX HAD A SMALL WET SPOT ON BOTTOM OF THE BOX. NO LIQUID ON THE FLOOR NO NEED FOR ZEP ZORBENT. PLACED THE BOX IN A GREEN PLASTIC DMP BAG AND REMOVED IT TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2025050033
item.description:
Report E-2025050033

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-02T15:18:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-03
  • City: CARLISLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 23:54 EDT on 4/3, XPO-BCA contacted ERTS to report a spill of about 2 cups of "Lithium Hydroxide Monohydrate" from a 50lb paper bag onto the trailer floor. The bag was punctured by a forklift at BCA. ERTS confirmed the product to be a regulated corrosive and will dispatch a contractor to assist. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1.5 cups of UN3110 Perkadox BCFF product released from (2) 55-pound boxes to the trailer floor due to improper loading. The contractors generated (2) 55-poly drums with the (2) boxes of product. The PPE and spill pads were submerged in water. The waste was staged onsite for terminal to manage.

item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-07
  • City: PHILADELPHIA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Hazmats came back on truck. Another QA admin and I placed damaged hazmats in hazmat bin and placed them in hazmat cage. After packing damages into hazmat bin the other QA admin took glove off using her mouth and later fell ill. The sort manager called 911 for her and she was transported to the hospital for treatment of her condition.
